SUMMARY: Zur, zinc uptake regulator, regulates genes involved in Zn2+ ABC transporter uptake system and genes involved in expression of alternative ribosomal proteins [9680209, 10816566, 12904577]. active conformation of Zur is observed when it is in a reduced form and when it is bound to Zn(II). oxidized form of Zur does not bind to DNA or zinc [9680209, 10816566, 11931550]. Zur is not autoregulated [11931550]. Zur, which belongs to Fur family [9680209], appears to have a DNA-binding site in N-terminal domain, around residue 65, and a signal-recognition site in C-terminal domain. This protein has two Zn(II)-binding sites: site A, which only binds to Zn(II), and site B ( sensor site), which binds to Zn(II) and Co(II) with high and low affinities, respectively [11523983]. Zur is able to form dimers, even in absence of zinc [10816566]. 23-bp palindrome consensus sequence for Zur-binding sites of gamma-proteobacteria, including Escherichia coli, has been determined by computational analysis [12904577].
